data.title: IDS 12.X EOS
data.meta_description: Hello All,               Can anyone tell me, is there any information for IDS 12.X EOS. if EOS is nearby my company will try to upgrade with 14.x.ThanksAmit Pat
data.text:
Hi Amit,

All of the IBM products have a Product Lifecycle and have a policy type (Standard, Enhanced, etc). Each poilicy has its own rules.

Enhanced:??Lifecycle policy Enhanced provides defect and non-defect product technical support for a minimum of five years from the date the product release was made generally available by IBM.?? Following a product???s announced End of Support date (EOS) there is the option to get support extensions for at least an additional three years for an extra charge set by IBM (enhanced ???5+3??? support).

Standard:??Lifecycle policy Standard provides defect and non-defect product technical support for a minimum of three years from the date the product release was made generally available by IBM.?? Following a product???s announced End of Support date (EOS) there is the option to get support extensions for at least an additional two years for an extra charge set by IBM (Standard ???3+2??? support).

Informix 12.10 (Enterprise, Workgroup, Express) has an "Enhanced Policy".

Informix 12.10.xx was released on 2013-03-26 and the end of support date (EOS) has not been annnouced yet. The EOM (End of market) has not been announced yet.

IBM supports at least the last 2 major releases of all of its products and can also support more if it does not decide on an EOS for a particular version.

So when version 15 comes out, it can decide to do an EOS for version 12.10.

We advise all of our customers to prepare to migrate to the last version available as soon as possible since the migration cycles can be long (depend on the customers procedures) and need to planified depending on the customers and the way they function.

For your own information, version 14.10 was released on 2019-03-14 and has the same policy as version 12.10.

-- Cordialement, Regards, Khaled Bentebal Directeur G??n??ral - ConsultiX T??l: 33 (0) 1 39 12 18 00 Mobile: 33 (0) 6 07 78 41 97 Email: khaled.bentebal@consult-ix.fr Site Web: www.consult-ix.fr

Hi Amit,

All of the IBM products have a Product Lifecycle and have a policy type (Standard, Enhanced, etc). Each poilicy has its own rules.

Enhanced:??Lifecycle policy Enhanced provides defect and non-defect product technical support for a minimum of five years from the date the product release was made generally available by IBM.?? Following a product???s announced End of Support date (EOS) there is the option to get support extensions for at least an additional three years for an extra charge set by IBM (enhanced ???5+3??? support).

Standard:??Lifecycle policy Standard provides defect and non-defect product technical support for a minimum of three years from the date the product release was made generally available by IBM.?? Following a product???s announced End of Support date (EOS) there is the option to get support extensions for at least an additional two years for an extra charge set by IBM (Standard ???3+2??? support).

Informix 12.10 (Enterprise, Workgroup, Express) has an "Enhanced Policy".

Informix 12.10.xx was released on 2013-03-26 and the end of support date (EOS) has not been annnouced yet. The EOM (End of market) has not been announced yet.

IBM supports at least the last 2 major releases of all of its products and can also support more if it does not decide on an EOS for a particular version.

So when version 15 comes out, it can decide to do an EOS for version 12.10.

We advise all of our customers to prepare to migrate to the last version available as soon as possible since the migration cycles can be long (depend on the customers procedures) and need to planified depending on the customers and the way they function.

For your own information, version 14.10 was released on 2019-03-14 and has the same policy as version 12.10.
